00022 #include "system.h"
00023 #include "settings.h"

00032 #define HOMING_AXIS_SEARCH_SCALAR  1.5  // Axis search distance multiplier. Must be > 1.
00033 
00034 
00035 void limits_init() 
00036 {
00037   LIMIT_DDR &= ~(LIMIT_MASK); // Set as input pins
00038 
00039   if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS)) {
00040     LIMIT_PORT &= ~(LIMIT_MASK); // Normal low operation. Requires external pull-down.
00041   } else {
00042     LIMIT_PORT |= (LIMIT_MASK);  // Enable internal pull-up resistors. Normal high operation.
00043   }
00044 
00045   if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE)) {
00046     LIMIT_PCMSK |= LIMIT_MASK; // Enable specific pins of the Pin Change Interrupt
00047     PCICR |= (1 << LIMIT_INT); // Enable Pin Change Interrupt
00048   } else {
00049     limits_disable(); 
00050   }
00051   
00052   #ifdef ENABLE_SOFTWARE_DEBOUNCE
00053   MCUSR &= ~(1<<WDRF);
00054   WDTCSR |= (1<<WDCE) | (1<<WDE);
00055   WDTCSR = (1<<WDP0); // Set time-out at ~32msec.
00056   #endif
00057 }
00058 
00059 
00060 void limits_disable()
00061 {
00062   LIMIT_PCMSK &= ~LIMIT_MASK;  // Disable specific pins of the Pin Change Interrupt
00063   PCICR &= ~(1 << LIMIT_INT);  // Disable Pin Change Interrupt
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 // This is the Limit Pin Change Interrupt, which handles the hard limit feature. A bouncing 
00068 // limit switch can cause a lot of problems, like false readings and multiple interrupt calls.
00069 // If a switch is triggered at all, something bad has happened and treat it as such, regardless
00070 // if a limit switch is being disengaged. It's impossible to reliably tell the state of a 
00071 // bouncing pin without a debouncing method. A simple software debouncing feature may be enabled 
00072 // through the config.h file, where an extra timer delays the limit pin read by several milli-
00073 // seconds to help with, not fix, bouncing switches.
00074 // NOTE: Do not attach an e-stop to the limit pins, because this interrupt is disabled during
00075 // homing cycles and will not respond correctly. Upon user request or need, there may be a
00076 // special pinout for an e-stop, but it is generally recommended to just directly connect
00077 // your e-stop switch to the Arduino reset pin, since it is the most correct way to do this.
00078 #ifndef ENABLE_SOFTWARE_DEBOUNCE
00079 ISR(LIMIT_INT_vect) // DEFAULT: Limit pin change interrupt process. 
00080 {
00081   // Ignore limit switches if already in an alarm state or in-process of executing an alarm.
00082   // When in the alarm state, Grbl should have been reset or will force a reset, so any pending 
00083   // moves in the planner and serial buffers are all cleared and newly sent blocks will be 
00084   // locked out until a homing cycle or a kill lock command. Allows the user to disable the hard
00085   // limit setting if their limits are constantly triggering after a reset and move their axes.
00086   if (sys.state != STATE_ALARM) { 
00087     if (bit_isfalse(sys.execute,EXEC_ALARM)) {
00088       mc_reset(); // Initiate system kill.
00089       sys.execute |= (EXEC_ALARM | EXEC_CRIT_EVENT); // Indicate hard limit critical event
00090     }
00091   }
00092 }  
00093 #else // OPTIONAL: Software debounce limit pin routine.
00094 // Upon limit pin change, enable watchdog timer to create a short delay. 
00095 ISR(LIMIT_INT_vect) { if (!(WDTCSR & (1<<WDIE))) { WDTCSR |= (1<<WDIE); } }
00096 ISR(WDT_vect) // Watchdog timer ISR
00097 {
00098   WDTCSR &= ~(1<<WDIE); // Disable watchdog timer. 
00099   if (sys.state != STATE_ALARM) {  // Ignore if already in alarm state. 
00100     if (bit_isfalse(sys.execute,EXEC_ALARM)) {
00101       uint8_t bits = LIMIT_PIN;
00102       // Check limit pin state. 
00103       if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS)) { bits ^= LIMIT_MASK; }
00104       if (bits & LIMIT_MASK) {
00105         mc_reset(); // Initiate system kill.
00106         sys.execute |= (EXEC_ALARM | EXEC_CRIT_EVENT); // Indicate hard limit critical event
00107       }
00108     }  
00109   }
00110 }
00111 #endif
00112 
00113 
00114 // Homes the specified cycle axes, sets the machine position, and performs a pull-off motion after
00115 // completing. Homing is a special motion case, which involves rapid uncontrolled stops to locate
00116 // the trigger point of the limit switches. The rapid stops are handled by a system level axis lock 
00117 // mask, which prevents the stepper algorithm from executing step pulses. Homing motions typically 
00118 // circumvent the processes for executing motions in normal operation.
00119 // NOTE: Only the abort runtime command can interrupt this process.
00120 void limits_go_home(uint8_t cycle_mask) 
00121 {
00122   if (sys.abort) { return; } // Block if system reset has been issued.
00123 
00124   // Initialize homing in search mode to quickly engage the specified cycle_mask limit switches.
00125   bool approach = true;
00126   float homing_rate = settings.homing_seek_rate;
00127   uint8_t invert_pin, idx;
00128   uint8_t n_cycle = (2*N_HOMING_LOCATE_CYCLE+1);
00129   float target[N_AXIS];
00130   
00131   // Determine travel distance to the furthest homing switch based on user max travel settings.
00132   // NOTE: settings.max_travel[] is stored as a negative value.
00133   float max_travel = settings.max_travel[X_AXIS];
00134   if (max_travel > settings.max_travel[Y_AXIS]) { max_travel = settings.max_travel[Y_AXIS]; }
00135   if (max_travel > settings.max_travel[Z_AXIS]) { max_travel = settings.max_travel[Z_AXIS]; }
00136   max_travel *= -HOMING_AXIS_SEARCH_SCALAR; // Ensure homing switches engaged by over-estimating max travel.
00137    
00138   plan_reset(); // Reset planner buffer to zero planner current position and to clear previous motions.
00139   
00140   do {
00141     // Initialize invert_pin boolean based on approach and invert pin user setting.
00142     if (bit_isfalse(settings.flags,BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS)) { invert_pin = approach; }
00143     else { invert_pin = !approach; }
00144 
00145     // Set target location and rate for active axes.
00146     uint8_t n_active_axis = 0;
00147     for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) {
00148       if (bit_istrue(cycle_mask,bit(idx))) { 
00149         n_active_axis++;
00150         if (!approach) { target[idx] = -max_travel; }
00151         else { target[idx] = max_travel; }
00152       } else {
00153         target[idx] = 0.0;
00154       }
00155     }      
00156     if (bit_istrue(settings.homing_dir_mask,(1<<X_DIRECTION_BIT))) { target[X_AXIS] = -target[X_AXIS]; }
00157     if (bit_istrue(settings.homing_dir_mask,(1<<Y_DIRECTION_BIT))) { target[Y_AXIS] = -target[Y_AXIS]; }
00158     if (bit_istrue(settings.homing_dir_mask,(1<<Z_DIRECTION_BIT))) { target[Z_AXIS] = -target[Z_AXIS]; }
00159   
00160     homing_rate *= sqrt(n_active_axis); // [sqrt(N_AXIS)] Adjust so individual axes all move at homing rate.
00161 
00162       // Reset homing axis locks based on cycle mask. 
00163     uint8_t axislock = 0;
00164     if (bit_istrue(cycle_mask,bit(X_AXIS))) { axislock |= (1<<X_STEP_BIT); }
00165     if (bit_istrue(cycle_mask,bit(Y_AXIS))) { axislock |= (1<<Y_STEP_BIT); }
00166     if (bit_istrue(cycle_mask,bit(Z_AXIS))) { axislock |= (1<<Z_STEP_BIT); }
00167     sys.homing_axis_lock = axislock;
00168   
00169     // Perform homing cycle. Planner buffer should be empty, as required to initiate the homing cycle.
00170     uint8_t limit_state;
00171     #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00172     plan_buffer_line(target, homing_rate, false, HOMING_CYCLE_LINE_NUMBER); // Bypass mc_line(). Directly plan homing motion.
00173     #else
00174     plan_buffer_line(target, homing_rate, false); // Bypass mc_line(). Directly plan homing motion.
00175     #endif
00176     st_prep_buffer(); // Prep and fill segment buffer from newly planned block.
00177     st_wake_up(); // Initiate motion
00178     do {
00179       // Check limit state. Lock out cycle axes when they change.
00180       limit_state = LIMIT_PIN;
00181       if (invert_pin) { limit_state ^= LIMIT_MASK; }
00182       if (axislock & (1<<X_STEP_BIT)) {
00183         if (limit_state & (1<<X_LIMIT_BIT)) { axislock &= ~(1<<X_STEP_BIT); }
00184       }
00185       if (axislock & (1<<Y_STEP_BIT)) {
00186         if (limit_state & (1<<Y_LIMIT_BIT)) { axislock &= ~(1<<Y_STEP_BIT); }
00187       }
00188       if (axislock & (1<<Z_STEP_BIT)) {
00189         if (limit_state & (1<<Z_LIMIT_BIT)) { axislock &= ~(1<<Z_STEP_BIT); }
00190       }
00191       sys.homing_axis_lock = axislock;
00192       st_prep_buffer(); // Check and prep segment buffer. NOTE: Should take no longer than 200us.
00193       // Check only for user reset. No time to run protocol_execute_runtime() in this loop.
00194       if (sys.execute & EXEC_RESET) { protocol_execute_runtime(); return; }
00195     } while (STEP_MASK & axislock);
00196     
00197     st_reset(); // Immediately force kill steppers and reset step segment buffer.
00198     plan_reset(); // Reset planner buffer. Zero planner positions. Ensure homing motion is cleared.
00199 
00200     delay_ms(settings.homing_debounce_delay); // Delay to allow transient dynamics to dissipate.
00201 
00202     // Reverse direction and reset homing rate for locate cycle(s).
00203     homing_rate = settings.homing_feed_rate;
00204     approach = !approach;
00205     
00206   } while (n_cycle-- > 0);
00207     
00208   // The active cycle axes should now be homed and machine limits have been located. By 
00209   // default, grbl defines machine space as all negative, as do most CNCs. Since limit switches
00210   // can be on either side of an axes, check and set axes machine zero appropriately. Also,
00211   // set up pull-off maneuver from axes limit switches that have been homed. This provides
00212   // some initial clearance off the switches and should also help prevent them from falsely
00213   // triggering when hard limits are enabled or when more than one axes shares a limit pin.
00214   for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) {
00215     // Set up pull off targets and machine positions for limit switches homed in the negative
00216     // direction, rather than the traditional positive. Leave non-homed positions as zero and
00217     // do not move them.
00218     // NOTE: settings.max_travel[] is stored as a negative value.
00219     if (cycle_mask & bit(idx)) {
00220       if ( settings.homing_dir_mask & get_direction_mask(idx) ) {
00221         target[idx] = settings.homing_pulloff+settings.max_travel[idx];
00222         sys.position[idx] = lround(settings.max_travel[idx]*settings.steps_per_mm[idx]);
00223       } else {
00224         target[idx] = -settings.homing_pulloff;
00225         sys.position[idx] = 0;
00226       }
00227     } else { // Non-active cycle axis. Set target to not move during pull-off. 
00228       target[idx] = (float)sys.position[idx]/settings.steps_per_mm[idx];
00229     }
00230   }
00231   plan_sync_position(); // Sync planner position to current machine position for pull-off move.
00232   #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00233   plan_buffer_line(target, settings.homing_seek_rate, false, HOMING_CYCLE_LINE_NUMBER); // Bypass mc_line(). Directly plan motion.
00234   #else
00235   plan_buffer_line(target, settings.homing_seek_rate, false); // Bypass mc_line(). Directly plan motion.
00236   #endif
00237   
00238   // Initiate pull-off using main motion control routines. 
00239   // TODO : Clean up state routines so that this motion still shows homing state.
00240   sys.state = STATE_QUEUED;
00241   sys.execute |= EXEC_CYCLE_START;
00242   protocol_execute_runtime();
00243   protocol_buffer_synchronize(); // Complete pull-off motion.
00244   
00245   // Set system state to homing before returning. 
00246   sys.state = STATE_HOMING; 
00247 }
00248 
00249 
00250 // Performs a soft limit check. Called from mc_line() only. Assumes the machine has been homed,
00251 // the workspace volume is in all negative space, and the system is in normal operation.
00252 void limits_soft_check(float *target)
00253 {
00254   uint8_t idx;
00255   for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) { 
00256     if (target[idx] > 0 || target[idx] < settings.max_travel[idx]) {  // NOTE: max_travel is stored as negative
00257     
00258       // Force feed hold if cycle is active. All buffered blocks are guaranteed to be within 
00259       // workspace volume so just come to a controlled stop so position is not lost. When complete
00260       // enter alarm mode.
00261       if (sys.state == STATE_CYCLE) {
00262         sys.execute |= EXEC_FEED_HOLD;
00263         do {
00264           protocol_execute_runtime();
00265           if (sys.abort) { return; }
00266         } while ( sys.state != STATE_IDLE || sys.state != STATE_QUEUED);
00267       }
00268       
00269       mc_reset(); // Issue system reset and ensure spindle and coolant are shutdown.
00270       sys.execute |= (EXEC_ALARM | EXEC_CRIT_EVENT); // Indicate soft limit critical event
00271       protocol_execute_runtime(); // Execute to enter critical event loop and system abort
00272       return;
00273     
00274     }
00275   }
00276 }
